sense.name: state of extreme physical devastation
sense.examples: The hurricane left the beach town in ruins. The cities of Germany lay in ruins at the end of World War II.

sense.name: social or economic downfall of someone or a group
sense.examples: The stock market crash of 1929 caused the ruin of many formerly wealthy families. His career was in ruins after years of alcohol and drug abuse. They feared his administration would lead to the ruin of the nation.

sense.name: a gradual physical process of disintegration or destruction
sense.examples: Environmentalists believe the halt of such practices will stop the gradual ruin of the rain forest. The old hotel was gradually falling into ruins through years of neglect. Emotional stress, smoking and no exercise are contributing to the ruin of his health.

sense.name: old remains of buildings, often from antiquity
sense.examples: The ruins in the Roman Forum span a number of centuries. The ruin on the edge of town is an 18th-century fortress built by the Dutch. Several famous Greek ruins are included on the tour.

sense.name: an agent of devastation or downfall
sense.examples: The man's uncontrollable anger proved to be his ruin. A lack of trust was the ruin of the peace accord. That man will be the ruin of Mary!
